intro: Lithospermum heliotropoides, commonly known as the sun-like lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling the appearance of the common heliotrope. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum heliotropoides is typically found in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun.
